name: Ayumu Memory Game
description:
Are you smarter than a chimp?

Reference Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zsXP8qeFF6A

From Wikipedia 11/25/2019: Ayumu (born 24 April 2000) is a chimpanzee currently living at the Primate Research Institute of Kyoto University. He is the son of chimpanzee Ai, and has been a participant since infancy in the Ai Project, an ongoing research effort aimed at understanding chimpanzee cognition. As part of the Ai Project, Ayumu participated in a series of short-term memory tasks, such as to remember the sequential order of numbers displaying on a touch-sensitive computer screen. His performance in the tasks was superior to that of comparably trained university students, leading to a possible conclusion that young chimpanzees have better working memory than adult humans.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayumu_(chimpanzee)

Inspiration and art by Yesim Taskin

The project goal is to make a fun version of this game for people to enjoy training in order to get better than Ayumu. After replicating the original program I want to extend it so that the number of digits extend to player's capabilities.

How many digits are you about to get up to?
